moves.1. e4: This was my first mini-tournament game.  I didn't know what to expect.
moves.1... e6 2. d4 c5: I've been experimenting with the Franco-Benoni.  It's not so common, but often morphs into interesting positions from other openings.
moves.3. dxc5 Bxc5: Usually White is not willing to trade a flank pawn for a center pawn and to help Black develop.
moves.4. Nf3 Qb6 5. Qd2 Nf6 6. Bd3: White's position here is fine.  In fact, I think it's preferable to Black's.
moves.8... Nxd2: A surprising oversight.  White resigned on the spot.  I'm sure this was not typical play for this 1601-rated player.
